questions.question_text_1: If the memory map for a device starts from the offset 0x40005000 and has a size of 1024 bytes in a 32-bit addressing scheme, what will be the last address in the memory map?
question_texts: If the memory map for a device starts from the offset 0x40005000 and has a size of 1024 bytes in a 32-bit addressing scheme, what will be the last address in the memory map?

options.option_text: Sizes of all the registers are 4-byte.
Sizes of ‘config_reg‘, ‘status_reg‘, and ‘counter_reg‘ are 4-byte, 1-byte, and 2-byte respectively.
Sizes of ‘config_reg‘, ‘status_reg‘, and ‘counter_reg‘ are 2-byte, 1-byte, and 2-byte respectively.
Sizes of ‘config_reg‘, ‘status_reg‘, and ‘counter_reg‘ are 1-byte, 2-byte, and 4-byte respectively.
Both the parent and child processes execute the ‘ls‘ command concurrently.
The child process executes the ‘ls -l‘ command, and the parent process waitsfor it to complete.
The parent process executes the ‘ls -l‘ command, and the child processterminates.

questions.question_text_1:
What is the correct sequence of setting up first user process?  
(i) Find an unused proc entry. (ii) Create trapframe. (iii) Create empty user process page table. (iv) Create context for process.
question_texts:
What is the correct sequence of setting up first user process?  
(i) Find an unused proc entry. (ii) Create trapframe. (iii) Create empty user process page table. (iv) Create context for process.

questions.question_text_1: Consider a process A that forks process B, and process B forks process C. Process A terminates, and process B continues to execute while process C forks a new process D. What is the parent process of D?
question_texts: Consider a process A that forks process B, and process B forks process C. Process A terminates, and process B continues to execute while process C forks a new process D. What is the parent process of D?

options.option_text: The base address of the process’s memory.
The number of system calls handled by the kernel.
The number identifying the requested system call.
The priority level of the process.

questions.question_text_1:
Consider a system with a virtual memory space size of 16GB and a single page table containing 220
entries. What is the size of each page frame?
question_texts:
Consider a system with a virtual memory space size of 16GB and a single page table containing 220
entries. What is the size of each page frame?

questions.question_text_1: Consider a system with 128 MB of physical memory and a 32-bit virtual address space. Given a page size of 8 KB, what will be the number of frames?
question_texts: Consider a system with 128 MB of physical memory and a 32-bit virtual address space. Given a page size of 8 KB, what will be the number of frames?

questions.question_text_1: What is deadlock in an operating system?
question_texts: What is deadlock in an operating system?

options.option_text: Processes waiting for input from the user.
A process that uses all available CPU resources.
A situation where two or more processes are blocked forever.
Processes consuming more memory than allocated.
A process that is waiting for an event or resource to become available.
A process that is temporarily inactive while waiting for some condition to bemet.
A process that has finished execution and is ready to be removed from theprocess table.

questions.question_text_1: In the xv6 operating system, if a process is waiting for I/O to complete, what will be the state transition of the process?
question_texts: In the xv6 operating system, if a process is waiting for I/O to complete, what will be the state transition of the process?

questions.question_text_1: Imagine a basic Linux shell that executes the ls -l command. Which of the following lists correctly orders the system calls initiated by the shell, starting from the moment the user enters this command until the shell resumes and prompts the user for their next input?
question_texts: Imagine a basic Linux shell that executes the ls -l command. Which of the following lists correctly orders the system calls initiated by the shell, starting from the moment the user enters this command until the shell resumes and prompts the user for their next input?

questions.question_text_1: When a process invokes the exec system call, which components in the Process Control Block (PCB) remain unchanged?
question_texts: When a process invokes the exec system call, which components in the Process Control Block (PCB) remain unchanged?

options.option_text: The value of the program counter
File descriptor table and memory information.

questions.question_text_1:
Assume the following processes are in various states: 
• Process P1 is waiting for I/O to complete. • Process P2 has completed execution, but its parent has not yet collected its exit status. • Process P3 is actively running on the CPU. • Process P4 is ready to execute but is waiting for the CPU. 
Select all the correct statements about the states of the processes.
question_texts:
Assume the following processes are in various states: 
• Process P1 is waiting for I/O to complete. • Process P2 has completed execution, but its parent has not yet collected its exit status. • Process P3 is actively running on the CPU. • Process P4 is ready to execute but is waiting for the CPU. 
Select all the correct statements about the states of the processes.

options.option_text: Process P1 is in the RUNNING state.
Process P1 is in the SLEEPING state.
Process P2 is in the RUNNABLE state.
Process P2 is in the ZOMBIE state.
Process P3 is in the RUNNING state.
Process P4 is in the SLEEPING state.
Process P4 is in the RUNNABLE state.
